FSharpFunc<string, FSharpOption<Tuple<string, double>>> bestCharset(FSharpList<string> x)

Intersects accepted and served charsets. Returns the preferred viable charset, or None.

FSharpFunc<string, FSharpOption<Tuple<string, double>>> bestEncoding(FSharpList<string> x)

FSharpFunc<string, FSharpOption<Tuple<string, double>>> bestLanguage(IEnumerable<string> x)

Intersects accepted and served media. Returns the preferred viable language, or None.

FSharpFunc<string, FSharpOption<Tuple<string, double>>> bestMediaType(IEnumerable<string> x)

Intersects accepted and served media. Returns the preferred viable media, or None.

FSharpOption<c> bestOf<a, b, c>(FSharpFunc<a, FSharpFunc<b, FSharpList<c>>> negotiate, a serves, b accepts)

FSharpList<Tuple<string, double>> filterMediaTypes(string mediaType, string accepts)

Filters an Accept header by type. E.g. filterMediaTypes "image" "image/png,text/html" -> ["image/png"]

FSharpList<Tuple<a, b>> filterSortAccept<a, b>(IEnumerable<Tuple<a, b, double>> x)

Takes a list of items with associated numeric quality (preference), and: removes all items with q=0 (i.e. not acceptable by client); sorts by q descending (client preference)

FSharpOption<string> matchCharset(string serves, string accepts)

Matches two charset tags

FSharpOption<string> matchLanguage(string serves, string accepts)

Matches two language tags

FSharpOption<string> matchMediaType(string serves, string accepts)

Finds a match between two media types, handling wildcards. Returns None if no match, otherwise Some media Example: matchMediaType "text/*" "text/plain" -> "text/plain"

FSharpList<Tuple<b, double>> negotiate<a, b>(FSharpFunc<a, FSharpFunc<string, FSharpOption<b>>> matcher, IEnumerable<a> serves, string accepts)

FSharpFunc<string, FSharpList<Tuple<string, double>>> negotiateCharset(FSharpList<string> x)

Intersects accepted and served charsets. Returns a list of viable charsets, sorted by client preference in descending order

FSharpFunc<string, FSharpList<Tuple<string, double>>> negotiateEncoding(FSharpList<string> x)

FSharpFunc<string, FSharpList<Tuple<string, double>>> negotiateLanguage(IEnumerable<string> x)

Intersects accepted and served languages. Returns a list of viable languages, sorted by client preference in descending order

FSharpList<Tuple<c, d>> negotiateList<a, b, c, d>(FSharpFunc<a, FSharpFunc<b, FSharpOption<Tuple<c, d>>>> matcher, IEnumerable<a> serves, IEnumerable<b> accepts)

FSharpFunc<string, FSharpList<Tuple<string, double>>> negotiateMediaType(IEnumerable<string> x)

Intersects accepted and served media. Returns a list of viable media, sorted by client preference in descending order

IEnumerable<Tuple<string, double, double>> parseAccept(string l)

Parses any Accept-* header, returns a seq of items with associated q (quality/preference)

FSharpList<Tuple<string, double>> parseFilterSortAccept(string l)

Parses any Accept-* header. Removes all items with q=0 (i.e. not acceptable by client). Sorts by q descending (client preference)

FSharpList<Tuple<string, Tuple<string, string>, double>> parseMediaTypes(string l)

Parses an Accept header into a list of media,(media type, media subtype),q E.g. "text/html",("text","html"),0.8

Tuple<string, double, double> parseQ(String[] s)

Parses a single Accept-* header item. Returns item with associated q
Parameters
String[] s

Header item split by ';'

Tuple<string, string> splitMediaTypeSubtype(string m)

Splits media type and subtype, e.g. "text/html" -> "text","html"
